actions.text: Amendment SA 3104 agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.

Amendment SA 3104 proposed by Senator McCain for Senator Lautenberg to Amendment SA 3048. (consideration: CR S4658; text: CR S4658) To require the Comptroller General to study the impact of the Internet Tax Freedom Act on State and local governments and on broadband deployment.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 3104 proposed by Senator McCain for Senator Lautenberg to Amendment SA 3048.
Senate amendment agreed to: Amendment SA 3104 agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.

amends_amendment.purpose: To extend the moratorium on taxes on Internet access and multiple and discriminatory taxes on electronic commerce imposed by the Internet Tax Freedom Act for 4 years, and for other purposes.

purpose: To require the Comptroller General to study the impact of the Internet Tax Freedom Act on State and local governments and on broadband deployment.
